page.title: 02South Pembs Hospital.Part 1
page.content:
The South Pembs Hospital was built as a direct consequence of two important factors viz:the strong military presence in the area and secondly for
the use of the dockyard workers.Today it is a general practitioners hospital with 36 beds for geriatrics,or beds for the elderly.The general practitioner ward can take up to 17 men and women.There is also a continuing care unit which holds two beds and was built with money donated by the National Cancer Research Society.Within the grounds there are 4 bungalows for the mentally handicapped with 8 in each bungalow.When full the hospital has about 91 patients but not all the beds are filled at all times.Six are for short stay patients who come into hospital so that their relatives or those who care for them
